intro: Cousinia rechingerorum, commonly known as the Rechinger's cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Cousinia rechingerorum is often found in elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,500 meters above sea level.
